medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute episode of epigastric pain, nausea, and vomiting
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Started around noon with severe epigastric pain, nausea, and episodes of vomiting, following a normal breakfast. Symptoms were unremitting until arrival at the ED, where they began to self-resolve. Pain described as gnawing without radiation to the back. Previous similar episodes lasted only a few hours.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC) diagnosed years ago, hypertension (HTN), eczema; previous hand surgeries, no abdominal surgeries.
medical_history.family_history: One child, healthy. Family medical history includes COPD in mother; unknown medical history in father; cousin with potential liver disease.
